message.content: We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The patient’s symptoms and laboratory tests suggest rheumatoid arthritis, and among the options, HLA-DR4 is the most commonly associated subtype with this disease. HLA-DR2 is associated with multiple sclerosis and systemic lupus erythematosus, HLA-DQ2 with celiac disease, and HLA-B27 with ankylosing spondylitis and other inflammatory arthritides.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The symptoms and laboratory results suggest rheumatoid arthritis (RA) and HLA-DR4 is the most commonly associated HLA subtype with RA, present in around 70% of patients. HLA-DR2 is associated with systemic lupus erythematosus, HLA-DQ2 is associated with celiac disease, and HLA-B27 is associated with spondyloarthropathies.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The patient presents with symptoms of rheumatoid arthritis, with positive anti-CCP antibody but negative ANA and RF. HLA-DR4 is the most common subtype associated with rheumatoid arthritis. HLA-DR2 is associated with multiple sclerosis and HLA-B27 is associated with ankylosing spondylitis. HLA-DQ2 is associated with celiac disease.
